required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Isoamyl 2-Cyanoacrylate in the Urethro-cutaneous Fistula Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Isoamyl 2-Cyanoacrylate Interposition in the Urethro-cutaneous Fistula Repair: A Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: cyanoacrylate has an impact that may aid in the successful repair of urethra-cutaneous fistula (UCF) that occur after hypospadias surgical repair

detailed_description.textblock:
Hypospadias is a common congenital urological birth defect. Urethro-cutaneous fistula (UCF) is the most common complication of surgical repair hypospadias and it remains the primary concern of surgeons dealing with hypospadias repair.
cyanoacrylate has been reported to enhance the healing process. this study tries to evaluate the clinical impact of cyanoacrylate on the repair of urethro-cutaneous fistula after surgical repair of hypospadias
this study evaluates the impact of using cyanoacrylate as an interposition substance in surgical repair of UCF after hypospadias in comparison to the classic surgical repair technique

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cases of group (I) underwent multilayered closure using dartos facial flap and cyanoacrylate glue as an interposition layer. Cases of the control group (II) underwent the same procedure without using cyanoacrylate.
study_design_info.masking_description: patients and their relatives were blinded to the type of the intervention

primary_outcome.description: surgical outcome regarding the repair of urethro-cutaneous fistula, whether adequate healing occurred or recurrence is present

secondary_outcome.description: report of the possible postoperative complications of both groups

arm_group.description: Cases of group (I) underwent multilayered closure using dartos facial flap and cyanoacrylate glue as an interposition layer.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cases of the control group (II) , classic repair
arm_group.description: Cases of the control group (II) underwent the same procedure without using cyanoacrylate.

intervention.description: using cyanoacrylate in the surgical repair of urethro-cutaneous fistula
classical repair of urethro-cutaneous fistula without the use of cyanoacryalte
intervention.arm_group_label: Cases of the control group (II) , classic repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Urethro-cutaneous fistula regardless of their age were included in our study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with fistula size more than 5 mm
- multiple fistulas
- uncorrected obstruction distal to the fistula
- necrotic tissue
- active infection at the fistula site
- severely scarred skin
- deficient dartos around the fistula
- fistulas more proximal to the mid penile position
- recurrent fistulas
- previous history of hypersensitivity to cyanoacrylate-based products

eligibility.gender_description: Hypospadias is a male urethral congenital anomaly
